text:
March 27, 1964
Faber and Faber, Ltd*
24 Russell Square
London, W.C. X, England
ACT: Permissions Department
Dear Sir:
We are requesting authorisation from Faber and Faber Publishing House to
use a poem by Marianne Moore, "Silence”, for which we understand you hold
the copyright. We have relived a note from Miss Moore giving us permission
to use her poem, but we also wanted to clear this permission with you
as the use of this poem will be for overseas use rather than use in the
United States.
Permission to use this poem is being sought by the N.A.E.B. in connection
with an arrangement we have with the Voice of America to develop an
English through Poetry series. The 13 commentaries for those programs
are being written by Professor M. L. Rosenthal of New York University.
Ifae Voice of America, in turn, working closely with Professor Rosenthal,
will produce 13 quarter-hour radio scripts on the basis of these
commentaries. 2he radio programs themselves are intended for broadcast
to listeners overseas, and are being designed to appeal to the listeners
interest in poetry in the English language.
In each script the poem will be read in its entirety, and the listeners
will also be invited to read the lines aloud in appropriate units after
the radio speaker.
Permission is sought both for the broadcast by the Voice of America to
overseas countries and for broadcast in countries where local radio
stations may receive the taped programs through the United States Infor¬
mation Agency. Permission is also sought for publication of the poems
that might be published in any given country (with the aid or supervision
of U.S.I.A.), and distributed free or at cost to radio listeners.
Permission is also sought for eventual publication of the materials in a
similar study booklet to be produced by U.S.I.A. for gratis distribution
to overseas listeners who request such booklets.
We hope we will hear from you shortly and that authorization to use
the material in the manner which we have outlined will be forthcoming.
